result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy David Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE called to request an ext for this Pymt Plan (due the 10th) & his Atty Fee Pymt Plan (due the 15th) until 10-16-17.  DE is approved to make a $100 pymt ($50 for ea case) by 4:30 pm on 10-16-17.  DE was advised to be sure he notes that $50 is to be applied to ea case.  jaf

DE called to state that he was recently laid off & is requesting an ext.  DE approved to make his Dec pymt by 8 am on 12-27-16.  DE was reminded that he is only being given an increased ext due to the holiday schedule.  DE stated he could likely pay before that via GPNet.  Includes 15CM73, 15CM708. jaf
DE called to verify receipt of Sept pymt.  Verified receipt of Sept pymt to DE & advised him next pymt is due on 10-10-16.  Includes 15CM73, 15CM708. jaf
DE called to verify receipt of his pymt.  Verified receipt of his July pymt & advised him of next pymt being due 8-10-16.  Includes 15CM73, 15CM708. jaf
DE appeared from court.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 7-10-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA.  Includes 15CM73, 15CM708. jaf
c: Def, Atty, DA & SCSO. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared. Case called at 8:36 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a PTC. There is a resolution. Atty Kucinski recites agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct w/o domestic abuse enhancer in 15CM708. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct w/o domestic abuse surcharge in 15CM708. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

- Fine in the amount of $243.00. DE to set up a payment plan.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared. Case called at 11:34 a.m. Atty Kucinski requesting another PTC. No objection by the state. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared. Case called at 9:15 a.m. No resolution, set for another PTC. If no agreement at that time, will set for trial. Address confirmed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference at 02-03-2016 02:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kristyn U.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
